rules_summary: Start with a strong, clear hook in the first 2-3 seconds to capture attention quickly.
Introduce the core value proposition within the first few seconds of the video.
Include text overlays to reinforce messaging, making your video content understandable even on mute.
Use captions to ensure accessibility and engagement, especially on mobile devices.
Maintain fast pacing with quick cuts to keep viewers engaged throughout the video.
Leverage visual changes every few seconds to sustain interest in the content.
Balance audio and visual elements to enhance the persuasive impact of the ad.
Ensure high quality visual production to reflect brand professionalism.
Focus on a single compelling message rather than multiple mixed messages.
Adapt your creative to fit the platform-specific audience and viewing habits.
Test different variations of your video to see what resonates best with your audience.
Track engagement metrics to refine your approach in future videos.
three_three_three_definition: Use a new visual or scene every 3 seconds to maintain interest.
Introduce or change the text overlay every 3 seconds to emphasize key points.
Alter the audio rhythm or beat every 3 seconds to keep the viewer's attention.
Employ eye-catching transitions every 3 seconds to create a dynamic flow.
Maintain viewer attention by consistently refreshing stimulus across visual, text, and audio elements.
hook_0_2_rule: Capture viewer interest immediately with a visually striking or intriguing element.
Pose a question or present a bold statement within the first 2 seconds to create curiosity.
Utilize motion or a dynamic visual to pull the viewer in immediately.
Apply contrasting colors or sharp movements in the first frames to stand out.
pacing_editing_rules: Optimize video length for the platform; shorter is often better for ads.
Use quick cuts and transitions to maintain momentum and interest.
Incorporate rhythmic editing to match music or voiceover beats, enhancing engagement.
Transition between scenes every 1-3 seconds to keep the video dynamic.
Use visual storytelling to convey your message succinctly and powerfully.
Ensure seamless integration of text and graphics to support and not distract from the narrative.
Vary shot sizes and angles to add visual interest and prevent monotony.
Match pacing with brand voice â€“ energetic for youthful brands, steady for professional tones.
Avoid static shots; implement subtle camera movements to add life to the video.
Align visual beats with the script or voiceovers for coherence.
Use close-ups for emotional impact and to capture nuanced expressions.
Maintain continuity yet surprise the viewer with creative elements.
